page.title: 10MECHANICAL MUSIC MUSEUM
page.content: Mechanical music has been around since 2 A.D. This museum was opened in 1971. It grew out of the owner's hobby. There are 64 instruments, from a 200 year old musical snuffbox to the "Trumpeter"- a Belgian fairground organ built in 1919. An automatic jazz band, used mainly in cafes was built in America in 1920. The first instrument in the collection was a polyphon, which plays metal discs with holes in to give the various notes. There were three pianolas which play from rolls of perforated paper. One of them had an automatic piano player. This had fingers which played when the operator worked foot pedals. We saw various music boxes in which the notes come from drums with teeth in them. One of them could play 8 tunes. The museum is very popular. It had 58000 visitors last year.
